programme.title: Home Town

programme.title: Home Town
programme.desc: After years of travelling, a bachelor is ready to buy a home where his family has lived for five generations. Ben and Erin find a cottage with good resale potential, and their design includes a stunning master bedroom and a quaint front porch.

programme.title: Home Town
programme.desc: Newlyweds are ready to move out of a parents' garage apartment and into their first home together. With an all-in budget, these two local artists hope to find a house with a master suite, large open kitchen and plenty of room for entertaining.

programme.title: Home Town

programme.title: Home Town

programme.title: Home Town
programme.desc: David and Taneia own a number of rental properties in Laurel and need Ben and Erin's help to help them choose which one will meet their needs as they enter their empty nester phase.

programme.title: Home Town

programme.title: Home Town
programme.desc: A single woman misses small town life and looks to make a fresh start in a historic home. Ben and Erin come up with big plans to update her home, but they encounter an unexpected problem that could derail the entire renovation.

programme.title: Home Town

programme.title: Home Town
programme.desc: Will, Courtney and their boys have outgrown their starter home, so they enlist Ben and Erin to help them find their forever house. On their wish list is a sizeable, historic house that's rich in character and small town charm.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A humpback whale mother and calf embark on a journey from tropical coral paradises to storm-ravaged polar seas. Indonesian coral reefs reveal seahorses, clams and sea kraits. Bull fur seals attack king penguins, and sea urchins fell forests of kelp.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Deserts cover one fifth of the planet and they are spreading every year. We think we are familiar with the Sahara and the Kalahari but what about the Gobi or the Atacama -so many deserts have hardly been explored.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The Arctic and Antarctic experience the most extreme seasons on Earth. Time-lapse cameras watch a colony of penguins, while aerial images show a polar bear swimming more than 100 km.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: After filming for three years, the shy Mongolian gazelle and the bizarre-looking Tibetan fox are captured on film. Over six weeks, the team follows a pride of 30 lions as they attempt to hunt elephants.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The ultimate portrait of our planet looks at the key factors that shape our natural history. In the Arctic spring, a mother polar bear and cubs have two weeks to cross the frozen sea. Time-lapse cameras capture the transformation created by floods.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mountain ranges reveals how animals rise to the challenge of mountain life. The snow leopard finds habitat in the largest glaciers of the world.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: From the evergreen forests of the frozen north to the deciduous dry forests of the Equator, discover the greatest woodlands on Earth.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: In the ocean, life goes to extraordinary lengths to survive this immense realm. A 30-tonne whale shark gorges on a school of fish. Deep sea octopus fly in the abyss and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colour display.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Follow the descent of rivers from their mountain sources to the sea. Witness unique and dramatic moments of animal behaviour, including a piranha frenzy and a showdown between otters and crocodiles.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Although often overlooked, caves are remarkable habitats with equally bizarre wildlife. This documentary provides a unique access to a hidden world of stalactites, stalagmites, snotites and troglodytes that brings a wealth of surprises.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Jungles cover roughly three per cent of our planet yet contain 50 per cent of the world's species. In the Ngogo forest, the largest chimpanzee group defends its territory from neighbouring groups. Other specialists include a parasitic fungi.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard is taken hostage by the Cardassians while on a dangerous secret mission.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The Enterprise attempts to rescue a tortured Picard from the Cardassians.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard and the others are trapped in a holodeck simulation with Professor Moriarty.

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: After Picard loses his life, Q gives him the chance to change his destiny.

programme.title: The Watch
programme.desc: Captain Sam Vimes' life in the City Watch is changed forever when an impossible figure from his past returns to Ankh-Morpork. 20 years ago, Vimes watched his street brother and gang-leader Carcer Dun fall from a fatal height. Somehow, Carcer is back.

programme.title: Starship Troopers
programme.desc: A group of naïve high school students joins a mobile infantry to fight off an invading force of giant alien bugs.

programme.title: Judge Dredd
programme.desc: A member of an all-powerful, futuristic police force is framed for murder by his brother.

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: A Romulan, Nero, travels through time searching for Ambassador Spock. Romulus is destroyed in the future and Nero holds Spock responsible. His vengeance brings him to the time of Kirk and Spock's youth where they are still in Starfleet Academy.

programme.title: The Watch
programme.desc: As fear of the dragon keeps people off the streets, The Watch must heist The Assassins' Guild, the city's most secretive and dangerous institution, in a desperate effort to find the precious magical artefact known as Gawain before Carcer does.

programme.title: Life Below Zero

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: Summer is drawing to a quick close, and the Alaskan winter lurks right around the corner. Before the tundra freezes over and the herds become scarce, Sue Aikens has limited time to hunt enough caribou to sustain herself for the harsh winter ahead.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: Sue sets off on a quest for food to survive the coming freeze. Andy and Kate race to get their fish wheel turning. The Hailstones build a cache to store caribou, and Glenn sets out on the most critical hunt of the year in hopes to harvest a moose.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: In Noorvik, the Hailstone family goes caribou hunting to put up meat for the winter. In Kavik, a bear poses a threat to clients at Sue’s camp. In Eagle, Andy repairs the fish wheel to protect the dogs’ food supply.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: Alaskans are preparing for the winter months. In Eagle, Andy hunts for elusive moose. In Kavik, Sue seals up camp and heads to Fairbanks for a foot procedure. In Chandalar, Glenn repairs his cabin ahead of the harsh winter.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: As temperatures grow colder, the Alaskans continue to prepare for the winter months.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: With dark winter just around the corner, Alaskans continue preparing for the winter months. In Noorvik, Chip builds a freight sled for winter travel. A blizzard strands Sue in Fairbanks and she must brave a notoriously dangerous road to get home to Kavik.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: Andy maintains the snow covered trails in Eagle. In Kavik, Sue fixes her generator in order to have electricity throughout winter. The Hailstones build a new teepee for their growing family and Erik takes his wife hunting for animal hides.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: In Eagle, Andy maintains the snow-covered trails. In Kavik, Sue fixes her generator. In Noorvik, the Hailstones build a new teepee to shelter their growing family for upcoming hunts. In Wiseman, Eric takes his wife hunting for animal hides.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: In Noorvik, the Hailstones stash emergency supplies along their hunting and routes. In Kavik, Sue’s contact with the outside world hangs in the balance. Erik takes a fall while gathering firewood. Andy attempts to trap muskrats for a winter meal.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: Chip and Agnes break trail to the Kiwalik River in preparation for hunting and fishing. Sue constructs a pair of snowshoes so she can travel through deep snow and scout the tundra. Andy fights frigid temperatures to replenish crucial resources.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: Andy constructs snares to maintain his food supply. Erik and Martha cut up their last moose quarter. Chip and Agnes go caribou hunting. And Sue clears her runway for a plane to deliver a new snow machine.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
programme.desc: As winter fades and signs of spring emerge, the Alaskans begin to store supplies for the coming months.

programme.title: Life Below Zero
